text:
Hello Guys,

Is there any logic, that I can use for updating contact if the contact exists already using REST API?
I am using "create contact endpoint" to create a contact from an external form. But when I use the same email address for the second time it gives contact exists error. So, I am looking for some logic(in python) that can then use "update contact endpoint" if the contact exists.
Thanks in advance!

hey <@UBQSVT1HA> use - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/create_or_update>
`it create a contact if it doesn't exist in an account already, or update it with the latest property values if it does.`

dont spend time doing that over API, just use <https://wizard.import2.com/apps/HubSpot>

will save you ton of time

for transparency, I am from Import2
Hey, <@UDU6KEBFB>! No, it’s not possible to use relative URLs in that field at this time.
For those following along I moved the conversation to a direct message to collect a couple of details to get a test portal enabled for this API.  Anyone else who needs this, please message me
Can I try something with "OR" `||` parameters
